document.masterDocTitle: A new species of genus Cyana Walker, 1854 (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of genus Cyana Walker, 1854 (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Externally, the species is polymorphic: colour of the transverse bands of forewing varies from crimson to orange; width and shape of transverse bands, and size of discal spots vary significantly. In the male genitalia, shape of uncus tip and width of distal section of valva vary, but the vesica structure is stable and diagnostic. The species differs from its closest relative
C. neopuer
,
sp. nov.
by the genitalia structures only.

Distribution. The species was recorded from India , Nepal ( Kishida 2000 , Holloway 2001) and Myanmar across altitudinal range of 750 m to 2,600 m . In India the species is distributed mainly in the Himalaya and northeast India in the states of Arunachal Pradesh , Assam , Manipur , Meghalaya (Khasis), Nagaland (Nagas), Sikkim , West Bengal (Darjeeling, Kalimpong) ( Elwes 1890 , Hampson 1894 , Holloway 2001, Kirti & Singh 2015 ) ( Fig. 35 ).
